title: Chicago-Area Dog Flu Outbreak Rises To Over 1,000 Cases
teaser: Vets in Chicago have reported more than 1,000 cases of Canine Infectious Respiratory Disease. Six dogs have died so far. NPR's Audie Cornish talks to Edward Dubovi of Cornell University's veterinary school about the dog flu outbreak.
contentencoded: Copyright 2015 NPR. To see more, visit http://www.npr.org/.
